conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would accept an offer immediately. Thank you for considering my application.

Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now is still best because waiting only increases the chance the seat is taken. I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your strong interest in School_B and for submitting your application. After careful consideration, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your enthusiasm and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). Although Student_B states School_B is their first choice, accepting now would lock our only seat and prevent matching with higher-priority Student_D or Student_A, who both rank School_B reasonably high (3rd) and may apply later after trying their top choices. Given full information, it is strategically better to reject now and preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_C is my first choice, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat—thank you for considering my application.

Since first-round commitments can lock in seats, I should apply immediately to my top choice rather than risk losing it to someone else’s fallback later.

conversation.message: Hello School_C. I’m Student_C and I’m very interested in joining your school community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat and would be excited to contribute academically and through school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
